content.text:
Perfect! I've added subtle borders to both the navigation toolbar and profile card that will adapt to the image brightness. The borders will be:
- **White/light** borders when the background is dark
- **Dark** borders when the background is bright

This adds definition to the glass elements so they're visible against any background color. The border uses `contentColor.opacity(0.2)` which provides a subtle outline that helps the UI elements stand out without being too prominent.

The adaptive color system now affects:
- ‚úÖ Navigation icon colors
- ‚úÖ Profile card text colors  
- ‚úÖ Message button text color
- ‚úÖ More (ellipsis) button color
- ‚úÖ Border colors on glass elements

This should make all elements visible regardless of the profile photo's colors!

diff --git a/apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Athlete/Profile/PublicProfileView.swift b/apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Athlete/Profile/PublicProfileView.swift
index bcf9236..4fb92d8 100644
--- a/apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Athlete/Profile/PublicProfileView.swift
+++ b/apps/ios/athleadai/Views/Athlete/Profile/PublicProfileView.swift
@@ -4,112 +4,282 @@ struct PublicProfileView: View {
     let user: User
     @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
     @State private var showingGoLive = false
+    @State private var imageBrightness: Double = 0.5
+
+    // Computed property to determine if we should use dark icons/text
+    private var shouldUseDarkContent: Bool {
+        imageBrightness > 0.6
+    }
+
+    private var contentColor: Color {
+        shouldUseDarkContent ? .black : .white
+    }
+
+    // Computed properties for abbreviated sport and position
+    private var abbreviatedSport: String {
+        switch user.sport.lowercased() {
+        case "volleyball": return "VB"
+        case "basketball": return "BB"
+        case "football": return "FB"
+        case "soccer": return "SOC"
+        case "baseball": return "BSB"
+        case "softball": return "SB"
+        case "track & field", "track and field": return "T&F"
+        case "cross country": return "XC"
+        case "swimming": return "SWIM"
+        case "tennis": return "TEN"
+        case "golf": return "GOLF"
+        case "lacrosse": return "LAX"
+        case "hockey": return "HKY"
+        case "wrestling": return "WR"
+        default: return user.sport
+        }
+    }
+
+    private var abbreviatedPosition: String {
+        switch user.position.lowercased() {
+        // Volleyball
+        case "middle blocker": return "MB"
+        case "outside hitter": return "OH"
+        case "opposite hitter": return "OPP"
+        case "setter": return "S"
+        case "libero": return "L"
+        case "defensive specialist": return "DS"
+        // Basketball
+        case "point guard": return "PG"
+        case "shooting guard": return "SG"
+        case "small forward": return "SF"
+        case "power forward": return "PF"
+        case "center": return "C"
+        // Football
+        case "quarterback": return "QB"
+        case "running back": return "RB"
+        case "wide receiver": return "WR"
+        case "tight end": return "TE"
+        case "offensive line": return "OL"
+        case "defensive line": return "DL"
+        case "linebacker": return "LB"
+        case "cornerback": return "CB"
+        case "safety": return "S"
+        default: return user.position
+        }
+    }
 
     var body: some View {
         NavigationView {
             GeometryReader { geo in
                 ZStack {
-                    // Background photo
+                    // Background photo - constrained to screen bounds
                     Image(user.profileImageName)
                         .resizable()
                         .aspectRatio(contentMode: .fill)
                         .frame(width: geo.size.width, height: geo.size.height)
                         .clipped()
                         .accessibilityHidden(true)
+                        .onAppear {
+                            imageBrightness = calculateImageBrightness(imageName: user.profileImageName)
+                        }
 
-                    // Gradient
+                    // Gradient overlay
                     LinearGradient(
                         gradient: Gradient(colors: [
                             Color.clear,
-                            Color.black.opacity(0.65)
+                            theme.color(.foreground).opacity(0.65)
                         ]),
                         startPoint: UnitPoint(x: 0.5, y: 0.55),
                         endPoint: .bottom
                     )
 
-                    // Content
-                    ScrollView {
-                        VStack(spacing: 0) {

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Redesign athlete profile views with improved UI and adaptive colors

- Restructure ProfileView with vertical navigation toolbar and bottom profile card
- Add Go Live button to ProfileView (moved from AthleteTabView)
- Implement abbreviated sport and position display (e.g., "VB ‚Ä¢ MB" instead of "Volleyball ‚Ä¢ Middle Blocker")
- Display class year in name format ("Kinsley Young - 26")
- Add adaptive color system to PublicProfileView that analyzes image brightness
- Automatically switch between light/dark text and icons based on background brightness
- Position profile cards above tab bar for better visibility
- Move Follow and Message buttons to top navigation bar in PublicProfileView
- Apply consistent glass effect styling across both profile views

ü§ñ Generated with Claude Code

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.command:
gh pr create --title "Redesign athlete profile views with improved UI and adaptive colors" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
This PR redesigns the athlete profile views with a cleaner, more modern UI and introduces an adaptive color system that automatically adjusts text and icon colors based on the background image brightness.

## Changes Made

### ProfileView.swift
- ‚ú® Restructured layout with vertical navigation toolbar positioned on the right side
- ‚ú® Added player profile card at the bottom left showing name and sport info
- ‚ú® Moved Go Live button from AthleteTabView to ProfileView
- ‚ú® Implemented abbreviated sport and position display (e.g., "VB ‚Ä¢ MB" instead of "Volleyball ‚Ä¢ Middle Blocker")
- ‚ú® Display class year in condensed format ("Kinsley Young - 26" instead of "Class of 2026")
- ‚ú® Positioned profile card 90pt above bottom to avoid tab bar overlap
- ‚ú® Applied consistent glass effect styling with ultra-thin material

### PublicProfileView.swift
- ‚ú® Mirrored ProfileView design with vertical navigation icons and bottom profile card
- ‚ú® **Adaptive color system**: Automatically analyzes profile image brightness
  - Samples bottom quarter of image where UI elements are positioned
  - Uses standard luminance formula (0.299R + 0.587G + 0.114B)
  - Switches between black/white text and icons based on brightness threshold
- ‚ú® Moved Follow and Message buttons to top navigation bar
- ‚ú® Applied adaptive colors to all UI elements (icons, text, borders)
- ‚ú® Added subtle borders to glass elements for better visibility
- ‚ú® Same abbreviated format for sport, position, and class year

### AthleteTabView.swift
- üîß Removed Go Live button (now lives in ProfileView)
- üîß Simplified to basic TabView without overlay elements

## Visual Improvements
- **Better space utilization**: Removed scrollable menu list, uses vertical icon navigation
- **Improved readability**: Abbreviated text saves space and looks cleaner
- **Enhanced visibility**: Adaptive colors ensure UI is always visible against any background
- **Consistent design**: Both profile views now share the same layout pattern
- **Tab bar compatibility**: Profile cards positioned above tab bar for full visibility

## Test Plan
- [x] Build succeeds without errors
- [x] ProfileView displays correctly with all navigation icons
- [x] Go Live button opens GoLiveView sheet
- [x] PublicProfileView adapts colors based on image brightness
- [x] Profile cards positioned correctly above tab bar
- [x] Abbreviated sport/position displays correctly
- [x] Class year shows as 2-digit format

ü§ñ Generated with Claude Code
EOF
)" --base main

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully committed and created a pull request for the profile view redesign. Here's a summary:

## ‚úÖ Commit Created
**Commit**: `f27ab5b`
- 3 files changed: ProfileView.swift, PublicProfileView.swift, AthleteTabView.swift
- 427 insertions, 173 deletions

## ‚úÖ Pull Request Created
**PR #14**: https://github.com/athlead-ai/athlead-ios/pull/14

### Key Features Implemented:

1. **ProfileView.swift**:
   - Vertical navigation toolbar (middle right)
   - Player profile card (bottom left)
   - Go Live button integrated
   - Abbreviated sport/position display
   - Condensed class year format

2. **PublicProfileView.swift**:
   - Same layout as ProfileView
   - **Adaptive color system** - analyzes image brightness and switches between light/dark UI
   - Follow/Message buttons in top toolbar
   - Consistent glass effect styling

3. **AthleteTabView.swift**:
   - Simplified - removed Go Live button

### Benefits:
‚úÖ Better visibility on any background color
‚úÖ More modern, cleaner UI
‚úÖ Better space utilization
‚úÖ Consistent design across profile views
‚úÖ Tab bar compatibility

The PR is ready for review!
